name: NPR
text: President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President Pence, are making preparations to get the coronavirus vaccine, hoping to instill trust and confidence in the vaccine ahead of its widespread distribution as the death toll climbs to new heights. https://t.co/lutdvLb0Ev

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President Mike Pence are making preparations to get the COVID-19 vaccine — hoping to instill trust and confidence in it ahead of its widespread distribution.
https://t.co/YiHGJYr1Zw

name: NPR
text:
About 80 million people didn't vote in the 2020 election. What motivated them?

A new survey finds nonvoters say they're disengaged and disaffected. They're also more likely to be Latino, younger, make less money and have lower levels of education.
https://t.co/ZFG47Nj4Ej

name: NPR
text:
RT @SachaPfeiffer: They're called "forever prisoners" -- held at Guantánamo without charge or trial.
 
There are more than two dozen of them at Gitmo.
 
And, in a rare development, one has been cleared for release after 18 years behind bars. https://t.co/VkgwF0i49R

name: NPR
text:
Russian government hackers are believed to be responsible for infiltrating computer systems at multiple U.S. agencies in recent months — including the Pentagon, DHS and the U.S. Treasury, government agencies report.

Here's what key players are saying.
https://t.co/YzD9biFXyQ

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Joe Biden is looking to Franklin Delano Roosevelt's transition to the presidency for inspiration as he and his team prepare to tackle a nation in the middle of numerous crises.
https://t.co/wOOGDgNiOO

name: NPR
text:
Many people who work as Santa or Mrs. Klaus depend on that income to pay for necessities like food and rent — and many are at increased risk for COVID-19 because of their age or weight.

Now, they're having to make tough choices about how to adjust.
https://t.co/EEoQyDzgRu
